entry.title: the Boshfather
entry.content: ... that "the Boshfather" was deported from Australia in October 2025?

entry.title: Queen's Theatre
entry.content: ... that the Queen's Theatre in East London was named to reflect its opening in the same year as the coronation of Elizabeth II?

entry.title: James Mange
entry.content: ... that reggae musician James Mange formed a soccer-themed political party to compete in South Africa's first democratic election?

entry.title: a park in New York City
entry.content: ... that a park in New York City occupies the former site of a waste transfer station and a heliport?

entry.title: 2014 Louisville, Mississippi tornado
entry.content: ... that the 2014 Louisville, Mississippi tornado was powerful enough that an entire door was torn off and blown 30 miles (48 km)?

entry.title: New Tide
entry.content: ... that New Tide was abandoned after many of its contributors left the country or joined the Chinese Literary Association?

entry.title: Matilda Freeman
entry.content: ... that Matilda Freeman did not originally intend to be an actress, but auditioned for a role after being teased by some classmates?

entry.title: Zenkoku Jiren
entry.content: ... that, when workers of the Zenkoku Jiren went on strike at a Hitachi factory, anarchist militants firebombed the mansion of Hitachi's president, Namihei Odaira?

entry.title: Ahmad Shah Durrani
entry.content: ... that Ahmad Shah Durrani (pictured) conducted fifteen major military campaigns during his reign, comprising nine invasions of India, three in Khorasan, and three in Afghan Turkestan?

entry.title: Off the Beaten Path
entry.content:
Off the Beaten Path

Andorra la Vella

Andorra la Vella is the capital of a quirky co-principality lodged in the mountains between Spain and France that offers great skiing, hiking, and lots of duty-free shopping.

entry.title: Destination of the Month
entry.content:
Destination of the Month

Kowloon

One of the most densely populated cities on Earth, Hong Kong's mainland portion offers a culture less influenced by the British than the neighboring Island, plus accommodation, dining, and nightlife are generally cheaper.
